title: Add method to auto-orient and DCT decode in one, to save end-users having to write their own.
body:
**The Problem**

Loading an image to resize it with the correct orientation is quite complicated. There's two choices:
1. Use `SkImage.FromEncodedData`, which handles the auto-orientation, but loads the full-res image, which can be time-consuming for large images. 
2. Use the Codec to decode the nearest-size instance of the image, and then manually auto-orient it - per the code [here](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/836#issuecomment-584895517).

I've found that for a 7MB 2952x1944 pixel image, with a target resolution for the thumbnail of just under 800x600, doing the first approach takes an average of about 900ms to load the correctly-oriented image, whereas doing the second approach takes around 150ms (these timings are on my M1 MacBook Pro, so ymmv); so it's nearly an order of magnitude faster to use the codec+orient method, despite being about 200 lines of code instead of two.

**The solution**

Add a method to SkiaSharp something like `LoadOrientedAndScaled( string fileName, int desiredHeight, int desiredWidth )` 
which wraps up all of the load, decode, and orientation code internally so that callers don't have to implement it themselves, but can take advantage of the performance improvements - as most developers/end users of SkiaSharp are likely to be loading down-scaled images, correctly oriented, for their apps.

**Additional context**

@Ziriax Described this much better than me [here](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/1517#issuecomment-863951202) and included some information about the auto-orientation implementation, along with some recommendations on how to use SIMD in-place operations so this could be even faster.

Or more like me many, because we have a project running on PI and an internal method to utilize orientation, and scale efficiently would be very welcome.
